tool_description: Analyzes wind speed and direction patterns to extract characteristics like wind shear, directional stability, and diurnal variations critical for turbine performance assessment.

wind_speeds.description: Wind speed measurements in meters per second

hub_height.description: Wind turbine hub height in meters for wind shear calculations

analysis_period.description: Analysis timeframe: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly

error_messages: Array length mismatch: Wind speeds, directions, and timestamps must have equal length.
Invalid wind direction: Wind directions must be between 0 and 360 degrees.
Invalid wind speed: Wind speeds must be non-negative values.
Invalid hub height: Hub height must be a positive number greater than 10 meters.
Invalid analysis period: Use one of [hourly, daily, weekly, monthly].
Insufficient data points: At least 10 measurements required for pattern analysis.
usage: Provide synchronized wind speed, direction, and timestamp arrays along with turbine hub height. Select analysis period based on desired temporal resolution of wind patterns.

mean_wind_speed.description: Average wind speed over the analysis period

prevailing_direction.description: Most common wind direction in degrees

wind_shear_coefficient.description: Calculated wind shear coefficient for the site

directional_stability.description: Wind direction consistency score from 0 to 100
